LEVENSHTEIN_EDIT_DISTANCE.text: Levenshtein edit distance for preference extraction

CORRECTNESS_LEVENSHTEIN.text: Ask user about correctness of match for Levenshtein results

PREFERENCES_RANDOM_ORDER.text: Allow preferences to be stated in random order or not

MULTIPLE_UTTERANCES_RESTRICTED.text: Allow preferences to be stated in a single utterance only, or in multiple utterances with one preference per utterance only, or without restrictions (any number of utterances and any number of preferences per utterance)

BASELINE_CLASSIFIER.text: Use your baseline for dialog act recognition instead of the machine learning classifier

ARTIFICIAL_ERRORS.text: Insert artificial errors in preference extraction

SUGGESTIONS_AFTER_FIRST.text: Start offering suggestions after the first preference type is recognized vs. wait until all preference types are recognized

INFORMAL_PHRASING.text: Use formal or informal phrases in system utterances

RESPONSE_DELAY.text: Introduce a delay before showing system responses

LARGE_NUMBER_RECOMMENDATION.text: Always offer a small or large number of recommendations

CONFIRMATION_PREFERENCES.text: Ask confirmation for each preference or not

CHANGE_PREFERENCES.text: Allow users to change their preferences or not

OUTPUT_IN_CAPS.text: OUTPUT IN ALL CAPS OR NOT

PROLOG.text: Use Prolog reasoning system instead of the default one.

PRINT_REASONING.text: Print reasoning steps used for preference inference.
